snippet: If Syrian rebel fighters portray their battle as a struggle for democracy, refugee children at the Zaatari camp in Jordan tell a much uglier story of sectarian revenge against Alawites.
abstract: Syrian rebel fighters portray their battle as a struggle for democracy, but refugee children at a camp in Jordan blame the war on Syria's Alawite Muslims, a minority ruling sect that the Sunni Muslims believe are responsible for driving them from their homes; youngsters offer a disturbing premonition that the conflict in Syria may shift into sectarian revenge.
lead_paragraph: If Syrian rebel fighters portray their battle as a struggle for democracy, refugee children at the Zaatari camp in Jordan tell a much uglier story of sectarian revenge against Alawites.
